Hacking the rares
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): FAQ: The Most Important Game Data: The /??? Breeds: Hacking the rares
By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 02:53 pm:

An idea that Foster had a while back intrigued me and got me thinking. For all the information we have on rare monsters, we really know very little about them. With that in mind, I plunged into the dex drive save file and began snooping around. Many thanks to Nevistar, Dark Phoenix, Richard Ryley, Xianiax, Corkasus (Sonnorat), and anybody else I forgot for helping me take the hacking plunge. He some information from my first foray:

Ok, well it wasn't immediately obvious but I think I'm figuring it out. I've got a Kokushi Muso as my active monster, so in 1A8C and 1A8E I've got values of F4 and F4. This was stumping me since F4 = 244 which made no sense, but I forgot I had to tack on a one to the value to convert to game shark values. Either that or the values of the next byte over (1A8D and 1A8F) need to be tacked on to the front of the register. Either way 1F4 = 500. So, the Kokushi Muso of the Mulan soundtrack has the same lifespan as a regular Durahan, i.e. 500 weeks.

I can't find the stat gain registers yet, they are not two bytes over from the form register in the dex save as they are in the game shark environment. For instance 1A9C, whoops, I take it back, there they are. The Kokushi Muso has values of 02,01,02,03,00,04. Translated to Pow 3, Int 2, Lif 3, Ski 4, Spd 1, Def 5. Lif/Pow/Int/Ski/Spd/Def is the standard format so the Kokushi Muso is 3,3,2,4,1,5. Looking over at the stat acquisition rates, a pure durahan has 3,4,3,3,1,5. So, the KM doesn't have quite the same power or intelligence, but is has better ski. There are other differences between the two. KM starts off with both guard and hurry battle specials. It does retain the +1 gain on domino just like a regular Durahan.

Whew, obviously I need: more practice (My hex reading, math, and conversion skills are a little rusty), a complete table of registers for all the freezer slots, more time, more rare cds. I've only got six rares right now (seven if you count the sucky suezo). I guess it's off to the used CD store for me!

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 05:22 pm:

Poison from the Matrix soundtrack
2,2,5,4,3,1 - Poison
1,2,5,4,4,1 - Pixie/Pixie

400 weeks lifespan for each. The poison has other differences though, aside from the extra attack "Heel Raid". It has battle specials grit and real. It gets a +1int on the mediate drill, but I think all pixie's get that.

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 05:46 pm:

Bronze Suezo from Tool’s Anemia
2,3,3,4,2,2 – Bronze Suezo
2,3,5,4,2,2 – Suezo/Suezo

Ummm, what a waste of a rare! Not only that, it only lives 430 weeks compared to a pure suezo’s 450 week lifespan. It gets no +1’s on any drills or errantries, and has only the ease battle special.

Unless you like Tool, or want to try for the Gold Suezo, save your money.

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 06:25 pm:

You wan't a work out? I just went through my cd's and I have 9 rares. That's six more to go. You want them one by one or all at once?

Ragae Plant, Express worm, Chef, Skeleton, Ultrajarl, and the worm you get off The Offsring's Americana, in that order.

Oh and thanks to Pesmerga who I forgot to mention earlier.

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 06:48 pm:

Raggae Plant from Bob Marley’s Legend
3,1,4,3,3,1 – Raggae Plant
5,1,3,3,2,1 – Plant/Plant

510 week lifespan for the raggae, 550 for the pure. Starts of with life steal attack, +1 int on meditate, +1 ski on Torble Sea errantry, and no battle specials.

Don't know if I'll be able to do them all tonight, but I'll try. Can you see that pattern that Pesmerga has picked up on?

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 06:59 pm:

Express Worm from Beastie Boy’s License to Ill.
5,2,3,3,1,2 – Express Worm
5,3,3,3,1,2 – Worm/Worm

480 weeks lifespan for the Express Worm, 400 for the pure. +1 pow on pull drill, no battle specials.

Getting a little faster at this.

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 07:11 pm:

Chef from Blink 182’s Enema of the State
1,1,4,4,4,1 – Chef
1,1,4,4,4,1 – Ghost/Ghost

420 weeks lifespan for Chef versus 400 for the pure. +1 on dodge (just like the pure), and no battle specials.

I’ll be back with the next in about a half an hour (gotta give my eye’s a rest).

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 07:47 pm:

Skeleton from Marilyn Manson’s Mechanical Animals
2,4,4,4,3,2 – Skeleton
2,4,3,4,4,2 – Henger/Henger

400 weeks lifespan for both. +1 ski on shoot (just like the pure), but you also start with the arm cannon attack and the vigor battle special.

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 08:03 pm:

Ultrajarl from The X-Files Songs in the Key of X
3,4,2,4,3,2 – Ultrajarl
3,4,2,4,3,2 – Bajarl

470 weeks lifespan for the Ultrajarl, 450 for the pure. Vigor battle special and bajarl beam attack.

Pesmerga just figured something else out about these rares. It's kinda based on his first discovery though, so, I'll tell you later if you can't figure it out. ;)

By Farmer Jimbo on Saturday, September 30, 2000 - 08:15 pm:

Worm/Worm from The Offspring’s Americana
5,3,3,3,1,2 – Worm/Worm (???)
5,3,3,3,1,2 – Worm/Worm

420 weeks lifespan for the “rare”, 400 for the pure. I haven’t really looked into battle specials on this one or +1’s. It does have the extra attack roll assault. Anyway, goodnight! That’s enough screen time for a while.

Thanks goes to the aforementioned trainers, and a second round of applause for Pesmerga.

By Farmer Jimbo on Monday, October 2, 2000 - 06:26 am:

The Offspring cd has been kicked around for a while. I can't remember who mentioned it first. Basically is just a pure worm with an extra 20 weeks lifespan and the roll assault tech.

Pesmerga figured out a pattern here while I was posting these. So, there's the first hint: all these rares have an extra 20 weeks lifespan, exactly 20 weeks...

Don't the battle specials and stat gains for the poison look familiar?

By Eagle Fierce on Monday, October 2, 2000 - 10:21 am:
